project.name: One Last Project

children.text: Cognoa is a pediatric behavioral health company specializing in the development of prescription digital therapeutics. Their latest initiative involved a nation-wide trial of an smartphone application for diagnosing Autism at an early age. Cognoa’s guiding principle here is that if timely diagnosis can be made more accessible, more children will get the treatment they need to ensure the greatest opportunity to thrive later in life.

As an employee of Bartlett Interactive, I worked with Cognoa to develop ten websites for ten cities across the country with the goal of finding people well-suited to participate in the first trials of the diagnosis application. The main purpose of the sites was to explain to parents who were eligible for the study, and to inform them of the process for having their child evaluated. Since children were only eligible given certain age restrictions and behavioral histories, the submission forms on the site were built with conditional logic to filter out unqualified participants, and obtain contact information for qualified participants. The data collection process was secure and private; all forms were compliant with regulations set by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), ensuring the privacy of sensitive health data for all participants.

The projects were built with WordPress, PHP templates, and the Elementor page-builder. The conditional forms were created using Gravity Forms and heavily customized using JavaScript in order to meet the Cognoa’s specific needs.
Disclosure: I built this project as an employee of
I do not own the rights to code on this website. Also, the trial for the research study has ended and the websites no longer exist.
